title: Remove damage on Ekko ult but have it reset cooldowns instead?
body: I think it would fit his lore better, as well as help establish him as an assassin and not a mobile fighter who can nuke an entire team. It fits the whole redo theme a lot better. It would still give him really high damage, but add some counterplay as he still has to re-land his skillshots to kill you, and a team can still turn around and kill him before he gets off his abilities.

replies.body: While it sounds good in theory, I think that it'd harm his kit. That's just my opinion.

> [{quoted}](name=Azukus,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ERL4N45g,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-06-03T16:59:44.317+0000)
>
> While it sounds good in theory, I think that it'd harm his kit. That's just my opinion.

The damage potential of a cooldown resetting ult would actually be higher than it is currently (single target at least). It would also be harder and more rewarding to land all of his hits as opposed to just an instant aoe.

Yes, but it would also remove a lot of the freedom he has with his ult. He'd only be able to use it if one enemy, alone, walked near his shadow. Multiple enemies would mean he absolutely couldn't go in unless he could also land a stun.

Also, harder and more rewarding are different things. It'd be much less rewarding, which is precisely why I believe you're suggesting the change. And it's already hard enough to land the ult on opponents practicing the proper counterplay.
Personally I think that ekko should be punished for ulting and appearing next to someone, rather than destroying them.
